poem.original: 難波津に　咲くやこの花　冬ごもり　今を春べと　咲くやこの花
poem.romaji: Naniwa zu ni/Sakuya kono hana/Fuyu gomori/Ima o harube to/Sakuya kono hana
poem.crunchyroll: Naniwa Bay, now the flower blooms, but for winter. Here comes spring, now the flower blooms.

poem.original: 秋の田の　かりほの庵の　苫をあらみ　わが衣手は　露にぬれつつ
poem.romaji: Aki no ta no/Kariho no io no/Toma o arami/Waga koromode wa/Tsuyu ni nure tsutsu
poem.crunchyroll: The autumn paddy shacks have rough thatching as my sleeves are wet with dew.

poem.original: 春過ぎて　夏来にけらし　白妙の　衣ほすてふ　天の香具山
poem.romaji: Haru sugite/Natsu ki ni kerashi/Shirotae no/Koromo hosu chou/Ama no Kaguyama
poem.crunchyroll: So spring ends and summer comes. Now white robes hang to dry on Mount Amanokagu.

poem.original: あしびきの　山鳥の尾の　しだり尾の　長々し夜を　独りかも寝む
poem.romaji: Ashibiki no/Yamadori no o no/Shidari o no/Naganagashi yo o/Hitori ka mo nen
poem.crunchyroll: The tail feathers of the copper pheasant are long, long as the nights I spend alone.

poem.original: 田子の浦に　うち出でてみれば　白妙の　富士の高嶺に　雪は降りつつ
poem.romaji: Tago no ura ni/Uchi idete mireba/Shirotae no/Fuji no takane ni/Yuki wa furi tsutsu
poem.crunchyroll: No matter where I stand on the shores of Tago, I can look up and see the snowy cap of Mt. Fuji.

poem.original: 奥山に　紅葉踏み分け　鳴く鹿の　声聞く時ぞ　秋は悲しき
poem.romaji: Okuyama ni/Momiji fumiwake/Naku shika no/Koe kiku toki zo/Aki wa kanashiki
poem.crunchyroll: While autumn leaves crunch under deer footsteps, the stag cries longingly for the doe.

poem.original: かささぎの　渡せる橋に　おく霜の　白きを見れば　夜ぞ更けにける
poem.romaji: Kasasagi no/Wataseru hashi ni/Oku shimo no/Shiroki o mireba/Yo zo fuke ni keru
poem.crunchyroll: When the misty bridge of magpie's feathers comes into sight, the night is nearly past.

poem.original: 天の原　ふりさけ見れば　春日なる　三笠の山に　出でし月かも
poem.romaji: Ama no hara/Furisake mireba/Kasuga naru/Mikasa no yama ni/Ideshi tsuki kamo
poem.crunchyroll: The sky may hold the same moon [...] which shines over Mount Mikasa.

poem.original: 我が庵は　都の辰巳　しかぞ住む　世をうぢ山と　人はいふなり
poem.romaji: Waga io wa/Miyako no tatsumi/Shika zo sumu/Yo o Ujiyama to/Hito wa iu nari
poem.crunchyroll: My own home is a retreat lying southeast of the capital [...] the troubles of this world.

poem.original: 花の色は　移りにけりな　いたづらに　我が身世にふる　ながめせし間に
poem.romaji: Hana no iro wa/Utsuri ni keri na/Itazura ni/Waga mi yo ni furu/Nagame seshi ma ni
poem.crunchyroll: So the flower has wilted during the long spring rains, just as my beauty has faded during my forlorn years in this world.

poem.original: これやこの　行くも帰るも　別れては　知るも知らぬも　逢坂の関
poem.romaji: Kore ya kono/Yuku mo kaeru mo/Wakarete wa/Shiru mo shiranu mo/Ousaka no seki
poem.crunchyroll: As friends and strangers come and go from the capital, they all exchange hellos and goodbyes at the famous gates of Afusaka.

poem.original: わたの原　八十島かけて　漕ぎ出でぬと　人には告げよ　海人の釣り舟
poem.romaji: Wata no hara/Yasoshima kakete/Kogi idenu to/Hito ni wa tsugeyo/Ama no tsuri bune
poem.crunchyroll: My only thought as I am put out to sea is to ask the fishermen to tell the people in the capital that I make for the islands.

poem.original: 天つ風　雲のひ通路　吹き閉ぢよ　をとめの姿　しばしとどめむ
poem.romaji: Ama tsu kaze/Kumo no kayoiji/Fuki toji yo/Otome no sugata/Shibashi todomen
poem.crunchyroll: The sky is the road home for the holy maidens, may the wind bring clouds to extend their stay.

poem.original: 筑波嶺の　峰より落つる　男女川　恋ぞつもりて　淵となりぬる
poem.romaji: Tsukuba ne no/Mine yori otsuru/Minanogawa/Koi zo tsumorite/Fuchi to nari nuru
poem.crunchyroll: Feel love deepen [...] widening into a river as it descends Mount Tsukuba.

poem.original: 陸奥の　しのぶもぢずり　誰ゆゑに　乱れそめにし　我ならなくに
poem.romaji: Michinoku no/Shinobu mojizuri/Tare yue ni/Midare some ni shi/Ware naranaku ni
poem.crunchyroll: I know that my heart is all aflutter and by no fault of mine.

poem.original: 君がため　春の野に出でて　若菜摘む　我が衣手に　雪は降りつつ
poem.romaji: Kimi ga tame/Haru no no ni idete/Wakana tsumu/Waga koromode ni/Yuki wa furi tsutsu
poem.crunchyroll: For you, I head out to the fields to pick spring greens while snow falls upon my sleeves.

poem.original: 立ちわかれ　いなばの山の　峰に生ふる　まつとし聞かば　今帰り来む
poem.romaji: Tachi wakare/Inaba no yama no/Mine ni oru/Matsu to shi kikaba/Ima kaeri kon
poem.crunchyroll: Note that though we may be apart, if I am to hear that you pine for me as the Inaba Mountain pines, I shall return to you.

poet: 在原業平朝臣 (Ariwara no Narihira) [825-880]

poem.original: ちはやぶる　神代も聞かず　龍田川　唐紅に　水くくるとは
poem.romaji: Chihayaburu/Kamiyo mo kikazu/Tatsutagawa/Kara kurenai ni/Mizu kukuru to wa
poem.crunchyroll: Impassionate gods have never seen the red that is the Tatsuta river.

poet: 藤原敏行朝臣 (Fujiwara no Toshiyuki) [Unknown-~907]

poem.original: 住の江の　岸に寄る波　よるさへや　夢の通ひ路　人目よくらむ
poem.romaji: Suminoe no/Kishi ni yoru nami/Yoru sae ya/Yume no kayoi ji/Hito me yoku ran
poem.crunchyroll: Silent waves creep closer to the Suminoe shore, and when night falls, in my dreams, I creep closer to you.

poem.original: 難波潟　短き芦の　節の間も　逢はでこの世を　過ぐしてよとや
poem.romaji: Naniwa gata/Mijikaki ashi no/Fushi no ma mo/Awade kono yo o/Sugushite yo to ya
poem.crunchyroll: May the time we spend apart from one another be as short-lived as the reeds of Naniwa Bay.

poem.original: わびぬれば　今はた同じ　難波なる　みをつくしても　逢はむとぞ思ふ
poem.romaji: Wabi nureba/Ima hata onaji/Naniwa naru/Mi o tsukushite mo/Awan to zo omou
poem.crunchyroll: My life means nothing after all the agonizing I have endured. I will not cast myself into Naniwa Bay, but I will risk my life to see you again.

poem.original: 今来むと　いひしばかりに　長月の　有り明けの月を　待ち出でつるかな
poem.romaji: Ima kon to/Iishi bakari ni/Nagatsuki no/Ariake no tsuki o/Machi idetsuru kana
poem.crunchyroll: After I heard you say [...] on a long September night, and then I saw a dawn moon.

poem.original: 吹くからに　秋の草木の　しをるれば　むべ山風を　嵐といふらむ
poem.romaji: Fuku kara ni/Aki no kusaki no/Shiorureba/Mube yama kaze o/Arashi to iuran
poem.crunchyroll: Gust of wind leaves fall leaves falling hence the name fall leaves.

poem.original: 月見れば　ちぢに物こそ　悲しけれ　我が身一つの　秋にはあらねど
poem.romaji: Tsuki mireba/Chiji ni mono koso/Kanashi kere/Waga mi hitotsu no/Aki ni wa aranedo
poem.crunchyroll: Feel sorrow wash over me when I see the moon, though autumn is not mine alone.

poem.original: このたびは　幣もとりあへず　手向山　紅葉の錦　神のまにまに
poem.romaji: Kono tabi wa/Nusa mo toriaezu/Tamukeyama/Momiji no nishiki/Kami no mani mani
poem.crunchyroll: As this trip takes me away in haste, I have only autumn leaves as an offering for the gods watching over me.

poem.original: 名にし負はば　逢坂山の　さねかづら　人に知られで　くるよしもがな
poem.romaji: Na ni shi owaba/Ousakayama no/Sanekazura/Hito ni shirarede/Kuru yoshi mo gana
poem.crunchyroll: May the scarlet kadsuras of Mount Afusaka live up to their name and allow us this secret rendezvous.

poem.original: 小倉山　峰のもみぢ葉　心あらば　今一度の　行幸待たなむ
poem.romaji: Ogurayama/Mine no momijiba/Kokoro araba/Ima hitotabi no/Miyuki matanan
poem.crunchyroll: While the autumn leaves of Mount Ogura would never understand human emotion, I beseech them to wait for the Emperor's return before falling.

poem.original: みかの原　わきて流るる　いづみ川　いつ見きとてか　恋しかるらむ
poem.romaji: Mika no hara/Wakite nagaruru/Izumigawa/Itsu miki tote ka/Koishi karuran
poem.crunchyroll: I feel as though I am like the Izumi river split, [...]

poem.original: 山里は　冬ぞ寂しさ　まさりける　人目も草も　かれぬと思へば
poem.romaji: Yamazato wa/Fuyu zo sabishisa/Masari keru/Hitome mo kusa mo/Karenu to omoeba
poem.crunchyroll: A mountain village grows lonesome every winter when people and grass grow scarce.

poem.original: 心あてに　折らばや折らむ　初霜の　置きまどはせる　白菊の花
poem.romaji: Kokoroate ni/Orabaya oran/Hatsushimo no/Oki madowaseru/Shiragiku no hana
poem.crunchyroll: As the first frost has fallen, I can no longer tell which chrysanthemums to pluck.

poem.original: 有り明けの　つれなく見えし　別れより　暁ばかり　憂きものはなし
poem.romaji: Ariake no/Tsurenaku mieshi/Wakare yori/Akatsuki bakari/Uki mono wa nashi
poem.crunchyroll: The sight of the lonely moon in the early morning reminds me of the lonely dawns after we parted.

poem.original: 朝ぼらけ　有り明けの月と　見るまでに　吉野の里に　降れる白雪
poem.romaji: Asaborake/Ariake no tsuki to/Miru made ni/Yoshino no sato ni/Fureru shirayuki
poem.crunchyroll: The hazed early dawn light comes not from the moon but from the crystal white snow of Yoshino.

poem.original: 山川に　風のかけたる　柵は　流れもあへぬ　紅葉なりけり
poem.romaji: Yama gawa ni/Kaze no kaketaru/Shigarami wa/Nagare mo aenu /Momiji nari keri
poem.crunchyroll: A mountain stream dips [...] as helpless autumn leaves are caught against the flow.

poem.original: 久方の　光のどけき　春の日に　しづ心なく　花の散るらむ
poem.romaji: Hisakata no/Hikari nodokeki/Haru no hi ni/Shizugokoro naku/Hana no chiruran
poem.crunchyroll: In the sleepy spring sunlight, a whirlwind of flower petals descends.

poem.original: 誰をかも　知る人にせむ　高砂の　松も昔の　友ならなくに
poem.romaji: Tare o ka mo/Shiru hito ni sen/Takasago no/Matsu mo mukashi no/Tomo nara naku ni
poem.crunchyroll: None are left who know me. Takasago pines can never replace them.

poem.original: 人はいさ　心も知らず　ふるさとは　花ぞ昔の　香ににほひける
poem.romaji: Hito wa isa/Kokoro mo shirazu/Furusato wa/Hana zo mukashi no/Ka ni nioi keru
poem.crunchyroll: In order for us to find our way home, the plum blossoms still smell the same.

poem.original: 夏の夜は　まだ宵ながら　明けぬるを　雲のいづこに　月宿るらむ
poem.romaji: Natsu no yo wa/Mada yoi nagara/Akenuru o/Kumo no izuko ni/Tsuki yadoruran
poem.crunchyroll: May it be that I find the [...] before this short summer night fully breaks.

poem.original: 白露に　風の吹きしく　秋の野は　貫き止めぬ　玉ぞ散りける
poem.romaji: Shiratsuyu ni/Kaze no fukishiku/Aki no no wa/Tsuranuki tomenu/Tama zo chiri keru
poem.crunchyroll: Since the dew atop the blades of grass has been scattered by the winds, it is as though pearls have been strung across the autumn plain.

poem.original: 忘らるる　身をば思はず　誓ひてし　人の命の　惜しくもあるかな
poem.romaji: Wasuraruru/Mi o ba omowazu/Chikaite shi/Hito no inochi no/Oshiku mo aru kana
poem.crunchyroll: My fear is not of being forgotten [...]

poem.original: 浅茅生の　小野の篠原　忍れど　あまりてなどか　人の恋しき
poem.romaji: Asajiu no/Ono no shinohara/Shinoburedo/Amarite nado ka/Hito no koishiki
poem.crunchyroll: The hazed field of reeds conceals clumps of bamboo shoots, but I cannot hide the love I feel for one who is so dear.

poem.original: 忍れど　色に出でにけり　我が恋は　物や思ふと　人の問ふまで
poem.romaji: Shinoburedo/Iro ni ide ni keri/Waga koi wa/Mono ya omou to/Hito no tou made
poem.crunchyroll: Since I could not hide my love, people would always ask if I was pining for someone.

poem.original: 恋すてふ　我が名はまだき　立ちにけり　人知れずこそ　思ひ初めしか
poem.romaji: Koisu chou/Waga na wa madaki/Tachi ni keri/Hito shirezu koso/Omoi someshi ka
poem.crunchyroll: As my love first came to realization, word had already spread.

poem.original: 契りきな　かたみに袖を　しぼりつつ　末の松山　波越さじとは
poem.romaji: Chigiriki na/Katami ni sode o/Shibori tsutsu/Sue no Matsuyama/Nami kosaji to wa
poem.crunchyroll: Impassioned vows exchanged over many a tear shed to last until the day waves crash over Mount Suenomatsu.

poet: 権中納言敦忠 (Fujiwara no Atsutada) [906-943]

poem.original: 逢ひ見ての　後の心に　比ぶれば　昔は物を　思はざりけり
poem.romaji: Ai mite no/Nochi no kokoro ni/Kurabureba/Mukashi wa mono o/Omowazari keri
poem.crunchyroll: The emotions experienced after a long-awaited reunion banish any lingering memories of the past.

poem.original: 逢ふことの　絶えてしなくは　なかなかに　人をも身をも　恨みざらまし
poem.romaji: Au koto no/Taete shi nakuwa/Nakanaka ni/Hito o mo mi o mo/Urami zaramashi
poem.crunchyroll: While it pains me [...] would I rather never see her again?

poem.original: あはれとも　いふべき人は　思ほえで　身のいたづらに　なりぬべきかな
poem.romaji: Aware to mo/Iu beki hito wa/Omooede/Mi no itazura ni/Narinu beki kana
poem.crunchyroll: The sound of people pitying [...]

poem.original: 由良の門を　渡る舟人　かぢを絶え　ゆくへも知らぬ　恋の道かな
poem.romaji: Yura no to o/Wataru funabito/Kaji o tae/Yukue mo shiranu/Koi no michi kana
poem.crunchyroll: Like a boatsman adrift at the mouth of the Yura, I do not know where this love will take me.

poem.original: 八重葎　茂れる宿の　さびしきに　人こそ見えね　秋は来にけり
poem.romaji: Yaemugura/Shigereru yado no/Sabishiki ni/Hito koso miene/Aki wa ki ni keri
poem.crunchyroll: A house left to the weeds welcomes no visitors but for autumn's coming.

poem.original: 風をいたみ　岩打つ波の　おのれのみ　くだけて物を　思ふ頃かな
poem.romaji: Kaze o itami/Iwa utsu nami no/Onore nomi/Kudakete mono o/Omou koro kana
poem.crunchyroll: When winds send waves crashing against the rocks in vain, I recall how my own efforts were in vain.

poet: 大中臣能宣朝臣 (Oonakatomi no Yoshinobu) [921-991]

poem.original: みかき守　衛士のたく火の　夜は燃え　昼は消えつつ　物をこそ思へ
poem.romaji: Mikakimori/Eji no taku hi no/Yoru wa moe/Hiru wa kie tsutsu/Mono o koso omoe
poem.crunchyroll: I feel that my love is [...] burning brightly by night, yet extinguished by day.

poem.original: 君がため　惜しからざりし　命さへ　長くもがなと　思ひけるかな
poem.romaji: Kimi ga tame/Oshi karazarishi/Inochi sae/Nagaku mo gana to/Omoi keru kana
poem.crunchyroll: For you, I would have given up my life, now together, I guard it dear.

poet: 藤原実方朝臣 (Fujiwara no Sanekata) [Unknown-999]

poem.original: かくとだに　えやはいぶきの　さしも草　さしも知らじな　燃ゆる思ひを
poem.romaji: Kaku to dani/Eyawa ibuki no/Sashimogusa/Sashimo shiraji na/Moyuru omoi o
poem.crunchyroll: When I must hide these burning feelings, I feel as though my body is on fire with Ibuki mugwort.

poet: 藤原道信朝臣 (Fujiwara no Michinobu) [972-994]

poem.original: 明けぬれば　暮るるものとは　知りながら　なほ恨めしき　朝ぼらけかな
poem.romaji: Akenureba/Kururu mono to wa/Shiri nagara/Nao urameshiki/Asaborake kana
poem.crunchyroll: The night breaks to day, and day turns to night, [...]

poet: 右大将道綱母 (Mother of Michitsuna) [~936-995]

poem.original: 嘆きつつ　独り寝る夜の　明くる間は　いかに久しき　ものとかは知る
poem.romaji: Nageki tsutsu/Hitori nuru yo no/Akuru ma wa/Ikani hisashiki/Mono to ka wa shiru
poem.crunchyroll: May my lonely nights in bed not be so long, though you have never known that pain.

poet: 儀同三司母 (Mother of Gidou Sanshi) [Unknown-996]

poem.original: 忘れじの　行く末までは　難ければ　今日を限りの　命ともがな
poem.romaji: Wasureji no/Yukusue made wa/Katakereba/Kyou o kagiri no/Inochi to mo gana
poem.crunchyroll: My fear is that you will forget your promise to never forget me, so I would prefer to die now while I am still happy.

poem.original: 滝の音は　絶えて久しく　なりぬれど　名こそ流れて　なほ聞こえけれ
poem.romaji: Taki no oto wa/Taete hisashiku/Narinuredo/Na koso nagarete/Nao kikoe kere
poem.crunchyroll: No more can we hear the sounds of the waterfall, but its legacy continues to spread.

poem.original: あらざらむ　この世の外の　思ひ出に　今一度の　逢ふこともがな
poem.romaji: Arazaran/Kono yo no hoka no/Omoiide ni/Ima hitotabi no/Au koto mo gana
poem.crunchyroll: The storm will soon carry me to the afterlife, so I wish for a memory of you to take with me.

poem.original: めぐり逢ひて　見しやそれとも　わかぬ間に　雲隠れにし　夜半の月かな
poem.romaji: Meguri aite/Mishi ya sore to mo/Wakanu ma ni/Kumo gakure ni shi/Yowa no tsuki kage
poem.crunchyroll: Long last we meet, only for me to leave hurriedly, for I could not recognize you, like the moon hidden behind the clouds.

poem.original: 有馬山　猪名の笹原　風吹けば　いでそよ人を　忘れやはする
poem.romaji: Arimayama/Ina no sasawara/Kaze fukeba/Ide soyo hito o/Wasure ya wa suru
poem.crunchyroll: The sight of Mount Arima with the bamboo leaves fading across the plains makes me wonder how I ever let you fade from my mind.

poem.original: やすらはで　寝なましものを　さ夜更けて　傾くまでの　月を見しかな
poem.romaji: Yasurawade/Nenamashi mono o/Sayo fukete/Katabuku made no/Tsuki o mishi kana
poem.crunchyroll: A night spent waiting until the moon began to set in the west when I should have gone to sleep instead.

poem.original: 大江山　いく野の道の　遠ければ　まだふみも見ず　天の橋立
poem.romaji: Ooeyama/Ikuno no michi no/Too kereba/Mada fumi mo mizu/Ama no Hashidate
poem.crunchyroll: While it brings me no joy, the road beyond Mount Oe is too long and I have yet to visit Amanohashidate or read my mother's letters.

poem.original: いにしへの　奈良の都の　八重桜　今日九重に　匂ひぬるかな
poem.romaji: Inishie no/Nara no miyako no/Yaezakura/Kyou kokonoe ni/Nioi nuru kana
poem.crunchyroll: After many, many years [...] now bloom inside the nine-fold palace.

poem.original: 夜をこめて　鳥の空音は　はかるとも　よに逢坂の　関は許さじ
poem.romaji: Yo o komete/Tori no sorane wa/Hakaru tomo/Yo ni Ousaka no/Seki wa yurusaji
poem.crunchyroll: Said night was young when the false rooster's crow, but the gates of Afusaka remained shut.

poet: 左京大夫道雅 (Fujiwara no Michimasa) [992-1054]

poem.original: 今はただ　思ひ絶えなむ　とばかりを　人づてならで　いふよしもがな
poem.romaji: Ima wa tada/Omoi taenan/To bakari wo/Hitozute nara de/Iu yoshi mo gana
poem.crunchyroll: After I determined to abandon my love, my only regret is that I have no way to tell you in person.

poet: 権中納言定頼 (Fujiwara no Sadayori) [995-1045]

poem.original: 朝ぼらけ　宇治の川霧　たえだえに　あらはれ渡る　瀬々の網代木
poem.romaji: Asaborake/Uji no kawagiri/Taedae ni/Araware wataru/Seze no ajirogi
poem.crunchyroll: The hazed early dawn mist over the Kawagiri River [...] nets in the shallows.

poem.original: 恨みわび　ほさぬ袖だに　あるものを　恋に朽ちなむ　名こそ惜しけれ
poem.romaji: Urami wabi/Hosanu sode da ni/Aru mono o/Koi ni kuchinan/Na koso oshi kere
poem.crunchyroll: Though my hatred has waned and the tears have dried from my sleeves, [...] that this love has also sullied my name.

poet: 前大僧正行尊 (High Priest Gyouson) [1055-1135]

poem.original: もろともに　あはれと思へ　山桜　花より外に　知る人もなし
poem.romaji: Morotomo ni/Aware to omoe/Yamazakura/Hana yori hoka ni/Shiru hito mo nashi
poem.crunchyroll: Would the mountain cherry blossoms return my affection, for there is no one else out here.

poet: 周防内侍 (Lady Suo no Naishi) [~1037-~1109]

poem.original: 春の夜の　夢ばかりなる　手枕に　かひなく立たむ　名こそ惜しけれ
poem.romaji: Haru no yo no/Yume bakari naru/Tamakura ni/Kainaku tatan/Na koso oshi kere
poem.crunchyroll: So spring nights are short [...] if my name were sullied by such a brief tryst.

poem.original: 心にも　あらで憂き世に　ながらへば　恋しかるべき　夜半の月かな
poem.romaji: Kokoro ni mo/Arade ukiyo ni/Nagaraeba/Koishikaru beki/Yowa no tsuki kana
poem.crunchyroll: As the years pass, I will find myself longing for the sight of a midnight moon.

poem.original: 嵐吹く　三室の山の　もみぢ葉は　龍田の川の　錦なりけり
poem.romaji: Arashi fuku/Mimuro no yama no/Momijiba wa/Tatsuta no kawa no/Nishiki nari keri
poem.crunchyroll: The storm blasts autumn leaves of Mount Mimuro to set the Tatsuta River ablaze.

poem.original: さびしさに　宿を立ち出でて　眺むれば　いづこも同じ　秋の夕暮れ
poem.romaji: Sabishisa ni/Yado o tachi idete/Nagamureba/Izuko mo onaji/Aki no yuugure
poem.crunchyroll: All alone, I step outside my house seeking comfort, but there is only desolation under an autumn sunset.

poem.original: 夕されば　門田の稲葉　おとづれて　芦のまろやに　秋風ぞ吹く
poem.romaji: Yuu sareba/Kadota no inaba/Otozurete/Ashi no maroya ni/Akikaze zo fuku
poem.crunchyroll: Like the sound of someone knocking on my door, the thistle and brush are blown by the autumn wind.

poet: 祐子内親王家紀伊 (Lady Yuushi Naishonnou-ke no Kii) [Unknown (active ~1087-1109)]

poem.original: 音に聞く　高師の浜の　あだ波は　かけじや袖の　濡れもこそすれ
poem.romaji: Oto ni kiku/Takashi no hama no/Adanami wa/Kakeji ya sode no/Nure mo koso sure
poem.crunchyroll: While some dodge the famous waves of Takashi shore to avoid getting wet, I deflect your artful words to keep my sleeves dry.

poet: 前中納言匡房 (Ooe no Masafusa) [1041-1111]

poem.original: 高砂の　尾の上の桜　咲きにけり　外山の霞　たたずもあらなむ
poem.romaji: Takasago no/Onoe no sakura/Saki ni keri/Toyama no kasumi/Tatazu mo aranan
poem.crunchyroll: Nobody wishes to see the beautiful cherry blossoms covered by the smoky mountain fog.

poem.original: うかりける　人を初瀬の　山おろしよ　はげしかれとは　祈らぬものを
poem.romaji: Ukari keru/Hito o Hatsuse no/Yama oroshiyo/Hageshikare to wa/Inoranu mono o
poem.crunchyroll: Though I prayed to the god of mercy that the one I love not shun me, I never asked to be treated colder than the winds of Mount Hatsuse.

poem.original: 契りおきし　させもが露を　命にて　あはれ今年の　秋もいぬめり
poem.romaji: Chigiri okishi/Sasemo ga tsuyu o/Inochi ni te/Aware kotoshi no/Aki mo inumeri
poem.crunchyroll: Impassioned was your promise of salvation. Alas, another autumn has passed in vain.

poet: 法性寺入道前関白太政大臣 (Fujiwara no Tadamichi) [1097-1164]

poem.original: わたの原　漕ぎ出でて見れば　久方の　雲居にまがふ　沖つ白波
poem.romaji: Wata no hara/Kogi idete mireba/Hisakata no/Kumoi ni magau/Okitsu shiranami
poem.crunchyroll: My only thought as the boat takes me out to sea is that the cresting waves almost look like clouds in the skies.

poem.original: 瀬を早み　岩にせかるる　滝川の　われても末に　あはむとぞ思ふ
poem.romaji: Se o hayami/Iwa ni sekaruru/Takigawa no/Warete mo sue ni/Awan to zo omou
poem.crunchyroll: Swift waters parted by the jagged rocks, are joined at river's end.

poem.original: 淡路島　通ふ千鳥の　鳴く声に　幾夜寝覚めぬ　須磨の関守
poem.romaji: Awaji shima/Kayou chidori no/Naku koe ni/Ikuyo nezamenu/Suma no sekimori
poem.crunchyroll: The sound of birds crossing from Awaji Island awakens the guards of Suma Gate at night.

poet: 左京大夫顕輔 (Fujiwara no Akisuke) [1090-1155]

poem.original: 秋風に　たなびく雲の　絶え間より　もれ出づる月の　影のさやけさ
poem.romaji: Akikaze ni/Tanabiku kumo no/Taema yori/More izuru tsuki no/Kage no sayakesa
poem.crunchyroll: The fall wind parts the wispy clouds to reveal moonlight, clear and bright.

poet: 待賢門院堀河 (Lady Taikenmon-in no Horikawa) [Unknown (active ~1142)]

poem.original: 長からむ　心も知らず　黒髪の　乱れてけさは　物をこそ思へ
poem.romaji: Nagakaran/Kokoro mo shirazu/Kurokami no/Midarete kesa wa/Mono o koso omoe
poem.crunchyroll: May I see you never forget your promise to always love me, as my concern this morning is as tangled as my black hair.

poet: 後徳大寺左大臣 (Fujiwara no Sanesada) [1139-1192]

poem.original: ほととぎす　鳴きつる方を　眺むれば　ただ有り明けの　月ぞ残れる
poem.romaji: Hototogisu/Nakitsuru kata o/Nagamureba/Tada ariake no/Tsuki zo nokoreru
poem.crunchyroll: Look for the sound of the cuckoo but instead you see a pale moon in the dawn sky.

poem.original: 思ひわび　さても命は　あるものを　憂きにたへぬは　涙なりけり
poem.romaji: Omoi wabi/Satemo inochi wa/Aru mono o/Uki ni taenu wa/Namida nari keri
poem.crunchyroll: While I sigh and lament the one I love does not feel the same, only tears can bring relief in this cruel life.

poet: 皇太后宮大夫俊成 (Fujiwara no Shunzei) [1114-1204]

poem.original: 世の中よ　道こそなけれ　思ひ入る　山の奥にも　鹿ぞ鳴くなる
poem.romaji: Yo no naka yo/Michi koso nakere/Omoi iru/Yama no oku ni mo/Shika zo naku naru
poem.crunchyroll: Said world grants no escape, I hide in the mountains, only to hear the haunting cry of a deer.

poet: 藤原清輔朝臣 (Fujiwara no Kiyosuke) [1104-1177]

poem.original: ながらへば　またこの頃や　忍ばれむ　憂しと見し世ぞ　今は恋しき
poem.romaji: Nagaraeba/Mata konogoro ya/Shinobaren/Ushi to mishi yo zo/Ima wa koishiki
poem.crunchyroll: May I live to see the day when I long for the agony I feel now.

poem.original: 夜もすがら　物思ふ頃は　明けやらで　閏のひまさへ　つれなかりけり
poem.romaji: Yo mo sugara/Mono omou koro wa/Ake yaranu/Neya no hima sae/Tsure nakari keri
poem.crunchyroll: Said bed was cold as I lay awake for the night would drag on when I thought of my beloved.

poem.original: 嘆けとて　月やは物を　思はする　かこち顔なる　わが涙かな
poem.romaji: Nageke tote/Tsuki ya wa mono o/Omowasuru/Kakochi gao naru/Waga namida kana
poem.crunchyroll: May my sighs be blamed upon the moon, or do my tears come from the feelings it invokes?

poem.original: 村雨の　露もまだ干ぬ　槇の葉に　霧立ちのぼる　秋の夕暮れ
poem.romaji: Murasame no/Tsuyu mo mada hinu/Maki no ha ni/Kiri tachinoboru/Aki no yugure
poem.crunchyroll: Rain takes longer to dry in the autumn time, leaving a hovering mist above the trees and grass.

poet: 皇嘉門院別当 (Attendant to Empress Kouka) [Unknown (active ~1175-1182)]

poem.original: 難波江の　芦のかりねの　ひとよゆゑ　みをつくしてや　恋ひわたるべき
poem.romaji: Naniwae no/Ashi no karine no/Hitoyo yue/Mi o tsukushite ya/Koi wataru beki
poem.crunchyroll: May the time spent in our one night together bring a life of everlasting love.

poem.original: 玉の緒よ　絶えなば絶えね　ながらへば　忍ぶることの　弱りもぞする
poem.romaji: Tama no o yo/Taenaba taene/Nagaraeba/Shinoburu koto no/Yowari mo zo suru
poem.crunchyroll: Nothing can be worse than living a moment longer when I cannot bear growing weaker than I already have.

poet: 殷富門院大輔 (Attendant to Empress Inpu) [1130-1200]

poem.original: 見せばやな　雄島の海人の　袖だにも　濡れにぞ濡れし　色は変はらず
poem.romaji: Misebaya na/Ojima no ama no/Sode dani mo/Nure ni zo nureshi/Iro wa kawarazu
poem.crunchyroll: I wish I could show the people how my sleeves have been soaked red with tears of blood.

poet: 後京極摂政前太政大臣 (Kujou Yoshitsune) [1169-1206]

poem.original: きりぎりす　鳴くや霜夜の　さむしろに　衣かたしき　ひとりかも寝む
poem.romaji: Kirigirisu/Naku ya shimo yo no/Samushiro ni/Koromo katashiki/Hitori kamo nen
poem.crunchyroll: For the cold nights when crickets are chirping, [...]

poem.original: わが袖は　潮干に見えぬ　沖の石の　人こそ知らね　乾く間もなし
poem.romaji: Waga sode wa/Shiohi ni mienu/Oki no ishi no/Hito koso shirane/Kawaku ma mo nashi
poem.crunchyroll: My own sleeves are like the sands at the edge of the ebbing tide, [...]

poem.original: 世の中は　常にもがもな　渚漕ぐ　海人の小舟の　綱手かなしも
poem.romaji: Yo no naka wa/Tsune ni mo ga mo na/Nagisa kogu/Ama no obune no/Tsuna de kanashi mo
poem.crunchyroll: Said world grants no change, I pray, when the fisherman who casts his nets can seem dear.

poem.original: み吉野の　山の秋風　さ夜更けて　ふるさと寒く　衣打つなり
poem.romaji: Miyoshino no/Yama no akikaze/Sayo fukete/Furusato samuku/Koromo utsu nari
poem.crunchyroll: I hear the beating of cloth, as a chilly autumn breeze descends from Mount Yoshino upon my long-forgotten home.

poet: 前大僧正慈円 (High Priest Jien) [1155-1225]

poem.original: おほけなく　うき世の民に　覆ふかな　我が立つ杣に　墨染の袖
poem.romaji: Ookenaku/Ukiyo no tami ni/Oou kana/Waga tatsu soma ni/Sumizome no sode
poem.crunchyroll: While it may be beyond my ability, I volunteer to shield the people with my dark sleeves.

poem.original: 花さそふ　嵐の庭の　雪ならで　ふりゆくものは　我が身なりけり
poem.romaji: Hana sasou/Arashi no niwa no/Yuki nara de/Furi yuku mono wa/Waga mi nari keri
poem.crunchyroll: So the flower petals are scattered like the snow by the passing storm, yet it is I who withers and wilts.

poet: 権中納言定家 (Fujiwara no Teika) [1162-1241]

poem.original: 来ぬ人を　松帆の浦の　夕凪に　焼くや藻塩の　身もこがれつつ
poem.romaji: Konu hito o/Matsubo no ura no/Yuunagi ni/Yaku ya moshio no/Mi mo kogare tsutsu
poem.crunchyroll: As I wait for someone who will never come, my body burns like the seaweed drying on the shores of Matsuho.

poem.original: 風そよぐ　ならの小川の　夕暮れは　みそぎぞ夏の　しるしなりける
poem.romaji: Kaze soyogu/Nara no ogawa no/Yuugure wa/Misogi zo natsu no/Shirushi nari keru
poem.crunchyroll: When winds blow oak leaves in the twilight, the only sign of summer is the ritual purification in the waters.

poem.original: 人も惜し　人も恨めし　あぢきなく　世を思ふ故に　もの思ふ身は
poem.romaji: Hito mo oshi/Hito mo urameshi/Ajiki naku/Yo o omou yue ni/Mono omou mi wa
poem.crunchyroll: In order to restore my faith in this world, I have learned to both love and hate my fellow man.

poem.original: ももしきや　古き軒端の　しのぶにも　なほあまりある　昔なりけり
poem.romaji: Momoshiki ya/Furuki nokiba no/Shinobu ni mo/Nao amari aru/Mukashi nari keri
poem.crunchyroll: Would this old palace courtyard and the eaves strewn with weeds be as dear now, those were the good old days.

poem.original: あかねさす　紫野行き　標野行き　野守は見ずや　君が袖振る
poem.romaji: Akane sasu/Murasaki no yuki/Shimeno yuki/Nomori wa mizu ya/Kimi ga sode furu
poem.crunchyroll: The crimson sunset sets these forbidden fields aglow. Wave not, for the guards may find us.
